column4: Hmm, i am copying files to my external HD via USB2. Theoretical speedlimit is 420Mbit = ~50MB per second. My ubuntu only transfers 17MB persec. Does ubuntu have some sort of problem with high speed transfers?
Some external 2,5" hdd need an external power supply to reach full speed
or is the conclusion that linux cannot handle USB properly?
try to reload the ehci_hcd mod
no idea how i do that
are all attached devices then affected?
furthermore, speed seems to be negatively correlated with time
reprobing the device did not work?
i have to wait to try that....im in the middle of a transferral right now
